Description: Tondo sherd of Attic red-figured pottery cup; interior: red-figure decoration consisting of legs of male figure, one crossed behind the other, possibly a piece of drapery, a staff crossing in front of the legs, a knotted stick to the left of the figure, and a band of semi-circles in added red; relief contour used; exterior glazed black.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The red chain reminds one of Herakles leading Cerberus, but the rest is difficult to interpret.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 514, no. C87)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0703) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain Fasc. 3, Oxford Fasc. 1 (p. 11, pl. XIV, no. 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
